page.title: 08HISTORIC BUILDINGS:IRCHESTER
page.content:
Knuston Hall lies just off the road between Irchester and Rushden.Though Knuston was once a small village, now there is just the big house and its estate.Knuston Hall was a private house until 1951.In that year it became a college and today it is a residential Adult Education Centre run by Northamp- shire County Council.
In Irchester High Street there are four listed buildings which are still inhabited.The Listed Buildings Guide dates them from the 18th century but the people who live in them think that parts of the buildings may be as much as four hundred years old.They are built of stone taken from a local quarry which is now part of Irchester Country Park.The outside walls of the cottages are two feet thick.
